summary: The document is a CIA memorandum dated 16 September 1975, addressing a request from Mrs. Lourdes CUESTA, the ex-wife of Antonio CUESTA Valle, who was imprisoned in Cuba. Mrs. CUESTA sought verification that her ex-husband was not connected with the CIA regarding certain raids mentioned in a Miami Herald article. The CIA carefully considered her request, noting her potential ties to Cuban intelligence (DGI) and her insistence on a written response. The memorandum details Antonio CUESTA's affiliations with various anti-Castro groups and confirms he had no operational missions with the CIA. It concludes with a drafted response to Mrs. CUESTA, denying any CIA involvement in the raids in question.
key_findings: Mrs. Lourdes CUESTA requested CIA verification that her ex-husband was not involved with the CIA in certain raids.
Antonio CUESTA was linked to anti-Castro groups but had no operational missions with the CIA.
Mrs. CUESTA had potential connections with Cuban intelligence (DGI) and demanded a written reply from the CIA.
The CIA prepared a response denying any involvement in the raids mentioned by Mrs. CUESTA.
